intro: Erysimum commatum, commonly known as the yellow wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with characteristic cruciform flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the stems are often hairy as well. Erysimum commatum is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant color and ease of care.
